// welcome Welcome to Chanity! Please register or login first. Get Started Sign In Welcome to Chanity!
// register login Â© 2022 Chanity Password Email Username Ready to create your account? Welcome back! Welcome back :)
// home Welcome %s ! Check your own personality by taking the test. The Big Five personality test measures the five personality factors that psychologists have determined are core to our personality makeup. The Five Factors of personality consists of: Start Test Ocean Image
// test Answer each question according to how well it describes you. Get Result Worry about things Make friends easily
// option menu Change Language Log Out Home Very Inaccurate Inaccurate Neutral Accurate Very Accurate Have a vivid imagination %s your primary trait is %s Percentage Result OCEAN Result %s{%}

%s{%}

%s{%}

%s{%}

%s{%}
%s Strengths %s Weaknesses %s
The sub-traits of openness personality trait are: Imaginative, adventurous, have high emotionality, have high artistic interests, intelligent and liberalism. Easy to collaborate with.
Creative.
Love to learn something new.
Open to diversity.
Give great attention to mental imagery. Easily swayed.
Their ideas are often unconventional.
Many of them are often unpredictable.
Tend to avoid positions that need to set rules and guidelines.
Tend to feel many emotions simultaneously which can lead to anxiety and depression.
The sub-traits of conscientiousness personality trait are: Well-organized, have strong sense of moral obligation, confident, achievement-striving, self-discipline and cautious. Organized and always come into situations prepared.
Attentive to detail.
Hardworking.
Rarely make impulsive or careless decisions.
Tend to pay attention to detail to make sure they deliver on their promises. Perfectionist.
May be excessively serious in some situations.
Inflexible.
Struggle to be spontaneous.
Tend to have obsessive-compulsive disorder.
The sub-traits of extraversion personality trait are: Friendly, gregarious, assertive, have high activity level, excitement-seeking and cheerful. Tend to relate well to others.
Often well-liked in their teams and offices.
Form quick and easy friendships.
Their outgoing nature leads to effective group-work.
Usually very determined, likely to take charge, and confident. May lack independence.
Can sometimes make others uncomfortable.
Struggle with keeping their emotions in check.
May be inconsiderate or sometimes socially unaware.
Often unable to make analytical, emotionless judgements.
The sub-traits of agreeableness personality trait are: Have high trust with people, altruistic, good at cooperation, have high morality, modest and sympathetic. Tend to get pleasure from taking care of people.
Get along well with others.
Are socially and emotionally intelligent.
Form friendships easily.
Refrain to judging people. Struggle to assert their wants, needs and preferences.
Struggle in situations that require tough decision.
Tend to forget to plan their own advancement.
Often likely to be taken advantage of.
Tend to overwork themselves due to an inability to delegate properly.
The sub-traits of neuroticism personality trait are: Anxiety, high anger level, depressed, have high self-consciousness, immoderate and vulnerable. Sensitive and aware in a way that some others might not be.
Likely to be the one who is always looking out for others.
Realistic.
Have high self-awareness.
Value the safety of knowing what to expect over the risk of disappointment from trying to engage in unfamiliar and unproven ways. Dramatic changes in feelings.
Tend to be more anxious when they perceive the situation to be negative.
Tend to experience a lot of stress.
Overly aware and sensitive about what others think of them.
Tend to self-doubt themselves.
